findings.title: Lack of events when adding or removing an address from the whitelist
findings.description: The contract does not emit events when adding or removing an address from the whitelist.

findings.title: Use consistent solidity pragma throughout all the smart contracts
findings.description: Inconsistencies in Solidity pragma versions across different smart contracts can lead to potential security vulnerabilities and compatibility issues.

findings.title: Redundant variable
findings.description: The variable might not be used in the business logic anymore and the function setMaxTxDate is restricted to the owner and does not affect the functionality of the token.

findings.title: Redundant Whitelisted Address Functions
findings.description: The whitelisted address has no further use in the contract, making associated functions and maps potentially redundant unless additional functionality is added.

findings.title: Block timestamp: Use of "block.timestamp"
findings.description: "block.timestamp" can be influenced by miners to a certain degree.

findings.title: Gas costs: Gas requirement of function Tango.transferOwnership is infinite
findings.description: If the gas requirement of a function is higher than the block gas limit, it cannot be executed.

findings.title: Gas costs: Gas requirement of function Tango.symbol is infinite
findings.description: If the gas requirement of a function is higher than the block gas limit, it cannot be executed.

findings.title: Gas costs: Gas requirement of function Tango.transfer is infinite
findings.description: If the gas requirement of a function is higher than the block gas limit, it cannot be executed.
